intro: Machaeranthera mexicana, commonly known as Mexican prairie verbena, is a flowering plant native to the central and southern regions of the United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in open grasslands and prairie habitats. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is adapted to full sun and well-drained soils. Machaeranthera mexicana is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits in native plant gardens.
